words_data.definition: To provide space or a place to stay for someone.
To examine something in detail to understand its structure or meaning.
A disagreement or a set of reasons given to support an idea.
Able to speak two different languages fluently.
A group of people chosen to represent a larger organization and make decisions.
An inner feeling or voice that guides you to do what is right.
Very brave and determined in the face of danger or difficulty.
The act of expressing disapproval or pointing out faults.
A person who is related to someone who lived in the past.
A serious, unexpected situation that requires immediate action.
To describe something as being larger or better than it really is.
Extremely interesting or charming.
A formal promise that a product or service will meet certain standards.
Funny or causing laughter.
Who a person is, or the qualities that make them different from others.
To explain something by using examples or pictures.
Decorative items like rings or necklaces worn on the body.
A room or building used for scientific research or experiments.
An official document giving permission to do or own something.
Written works, such as books, poems, and plays, that have artistic value.
A legal agreement where a bank lends money to buy a house.
Easy to see or observe.
A particular event or a special time.
Someone who is against you in a contest, game, or argument.
Lasting or intended to last forever.
To convince someone to do or believe something through reasoning.
A list of questions used to gather information from people.
A suggestion or advice about what is best for a particular purpose.
A place where people pay to sit and eat meals that are cooked there.
A strong, regular, repeated pattern of movement or sound.

Great or important enough to be worthy of attention.
A student in their second year of high school or college.
The degree of heat or cold in an object or environment.
The ability to accept or put up with opinions or behaviors you dislike.
A series of contests between several players or teams.
When everyone in a group is in complete agreement.

A character in a story who does evil things.
To make a word or phrase shorter.
The science or practice of farming and growing crops.
A person who takes part in an activity for pleasure rather than as a job.
A sudden event that causes great damage or suffering.

The distance around the edge of a circle.
An event where people or teams try to win against each other.
A word used to connect sentences or parts of sentences together.
The process of growing, changing, or becoming more advanced.
A simplified drawing showing how something works or is organized.
The practice of training people to obey rules and using punishment to correct them.
When the sun or moon is hidden by another celestial body.
A book or set of books giving information on many subjects.
The natural world around us, including air, water, and land.
Equal in value, amount, or meaning.
A short trip or outing, usually for pleasure.

The elected leader of a state or territory.
Dangerous or risky to health and safety.
To pause before doing something because you are unsure.
A person who comes to live permanently in a foreign country.
A period of time or distance between two events or objects.
The official power to make legal decisions and judgments.
A school or class for young children before they start first grade.
Very beautiful, impressive, or grand.

A handwritten or typed version of a book before it is printed.
The state of being required or indispensable.

A small booklet or leaflet containing information on a single subject.
Relating to the body rather than the mind.
A special right or advantage given only to a particular person or group.
A four-sided shape with four right angles and unequal adjacent sides.
A practice session for a play, concert, or other performance.
An object that orbits around a planet or star.
Critical and thorough observation or examination.
The dark shape and outline of someone or something against a light background.
A particular way of doing something, especially one requiring skill.
A person who has served in the military; also someone with long experience.
A written promise to repair or replace a product if it breaks.
The process by which one thing takes in another.
Something added to something else to make it more useful or attractive.
The branch of physics that deals with the properties of sound.
A person one knows slightly, but who is not a close friend.
The period of life when a person develops from a child into an adult.
A written statement confirmed by oath or affirmation for use as evidence in court.
Arranging things in a straight line or in correct positions relative to each other.
A substance that prevents the growth of disease-causing microorganisms.
The technical equipment or machinery needed for a particular activity.
The art and science of designing and constructing buildings.
The evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, or ability of someone or something.
A legal state where a person or business cannot pay their debts.
A wide street in a town or city, typically one lined with trees.
A complex system of government or business administration with many rules.
A small electronic device used for mathematical calculations.
A person who applies for a job or is nominated for election.
An animal that feeds primarily on flesh or meat.
The hard shell that protects a caterpillar as it turns into a butterfly.
An alliance for combined action, especially a temporary union of political parties.
Something pledged as security for repayment of a loan.
Able to catch fire and burn easily.
An explanation or set of notes on a text; also a spoken account of an event.
Sympathetic pity and concern for the sufferings of others.
Something, typically money, awarded to someone as a recompense for loss or injury.
A person or organization that is competing against others.
The action of focusing one's full attention; also the amount of a substance in a space.

The action of establishing the truth or correctness of something.
A result or effect of an action or condition.

Spread from one person or organism to another by direct or indirect contact.

A person trained to give guidance on personal, social, or psychological problems.

To become progressively worse in quality or condition.

A lack of compatibility or similarity between two or more facts.

A difference or contrast between similar things or people.
Achieving maximum productivity with minimum wasted effort or expense.
The state of having the right to do or obtain something.
Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
The act of leaving one's own country to settle permanently in another.
Special importance, value, or prominence given to something.
A person who sets up a business, taking on financial risks in the hope of profit.
A state in which opposing forces or influences are perfectly balanced.

A statement that represents something as better or worse than it really is.
Unusually good; much better than average.

A public display of works of art or items of interest.
The state of thinking or hoping that something, especially something good, will happen.
Spending much more than is necessary or wise.
A person who holds extreme or fanatical political or religious views.
The act of inventing something, typically a lie; also the manufacturing process.
Close acquaintance with or knowledge of something.
The chemical breakdown of a substance by bacteria or yeast, typically involved in making bread or alcohol.
Giving off bright light when exposed to radiation; very vivid.
The action of forming or the process of being formed; also a structure.
Inspiring fear or respect through being impressively large, powerful, or intense.
A person who establishes an institution or settlement; also, to fail or sink.

Splendor and impressiveness, especially of appearance or style.
A real or imagined wrong or other cause for complaint or protest.
Passed on from parent to child through genes.
A system in which members are ranked according to relative status or authority.
Consisting of parts that are all of the same kind.
The lightest chemical element; it is a gas with no color or smell.
Pretending to have moral standards or beliefs that one does not actually follow.

To light up or make something clear and easier to understand.
A picture or diagram that explains or decorates a text.
Visually descriptive or figurative language in writing.
A copy of something else, often intended to look like the original.
Fair and just; not favoring one side over another.
To put a decision, plan, or agreement into effect.
The conclusion that can be drawn from something although it is not explicitly stated.
An idea, feeling, or opinion about something or someone.
Not alive; showing no signs of life.

The rate of occurrence of something, such as a disease.
Not clearly expressed or defined; lasting for an unknown period.

Originating or occurring naturally in a particular place; native.
A thing that persuades or influences someone to do something.
Certain to happen; unavoidable.

A physical condition where part of the body becomes reddened, swollen, and painful.

Clever, original, and inventive.
One of the substances that are combined to make a particular dish.
A person or animal that lives in or occupies a place.
Money, property, or traits received from ancestors.

A new method, idea, or product.

Habitual sleeplessness; inability to sleep.
A careful examination or scrutiny of something.
Doing something naturally without thinking.
An organization having a particular purpose, especially scientific or educational.

The quality of being honest and having strong moral principles.
Relating to the ability to think and understand complex ideas.
The ability to acquire and apply knowledge and skills.
Concentrated on a single area or subject; very thorough.

Coming between two things in time, place, order, or character.
The action of explaining the meaning of something.

Very complicated or detailed.

Done without will or conscious control.
Not logical or reasonable.

Relating to a judgment, the law, or the administration of justice.
The action of showing something to be right or reasonable.

All the visible features of an area of countryside or land.

Conforming to the law or to rules.

Impressively beautiful, elaborate, or extravagant; striking.

Intending or intended to do harm.

Clear or obvious to the eye or mind.

Relating to a large city and its surrounding areas.

Very small of its kind; much smaller than normal.

Relating to a city or town or its governing body.

Relating to or expressed as a number or numbers.

A thing that blocks one's way or prevents progress.

An incident or event.
Causing someone to feel deeply hurt, upset, or angry.

Holding to one's own ideas and opinions too strongly.

Relevant or applicable to a particular matter.

Present as the strongest or main element.
